item.title: Susan add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "There is no such thing as "Just a cat." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Susan add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Susan add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Beautiful young people are accidents of nature, but beautiful old people are works of art. " -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Susan add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Susan add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Learn from the mistakes of others. You canâ€™t live long enough to make them all yourself. " -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Susan add a quote by Peter Stone
item.description: "In my many years I have come to a conclusion that one useless man is a shame, two is a law firm, and three or more is a congress." -- Peter Stone

item.title: Susan add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "When they call the roll in the Senate, the Senators do not know whether to answer 'Present' or 'Not Guilty'." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Susan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Susan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Susan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Susan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Susan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
